<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SUSTAINABILITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/investors-tough-passive-aggressive?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
More Like GreenRock
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of a gas pump covered in leaves" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5MDM2NzY4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, BlackRock CEO Larry Fink <a href="https://www.blackrock.com/us/individual/larry-fink-ceo-letter?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> in his annual letter to CEOs that he plans to make confronting climate change a key component of his firm’s strategy. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>BlackRock is the world’s biggest asset manager and banks rely on its software to assess risk. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fink said the economic consequences of climate change pushed him to make the decision. “The evidence on climate risk is compelling investors to reassess core assumptions about modern finance,” he wrote. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What it means </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fink said BlackRock will <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/blackrock-shakes-up-sustainable-investing-business-following-criticism-11579000873?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vote against</a> boards and management that fail to a) account for climate risks or b) make progress on sustainability plans. Other <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-14/blackrock-s-uncomfortable-truth-going-green-won-t-be-easy?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">BlackRock strategies</a> are to...</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pressure index providers to add more sustainable benchmarks </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Double its sustainable exchange-traded funds (ETFs) to 150 </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sell $500 million worth of investments in thermal coal producers by the middle of 2020</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s the catch: </strong>Neither Fink nor BlackRock can really flip that switch. Two-thirds of BlackRock’s almost $7 trillion under management is held in passive funds that follow market indexes wherever they may lead. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Market compilers like MSCI and the London Stock Exchange’s FTSE Russell unit call the shots on those funds, not BlackRock. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>So BlackRock will have to lean hard on strategy #1 if it’s going to deliver on this goal. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Last year, protesters <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-climate-change-britain-blackrock/climate-activists-protest-at-blackrock-over-investments-in-the-amazon-idUSKBN1XP13X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried to persuade</a> BlackRock to divest from its fossil fuel holdings. Now, BlackRock could lead other money managers in a pivot to sustainability. Earlier this month, it joined <a href="https://climateaction100.wordpress.com/about-us/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Climate Action 100+</a>, a group of investors committing to the environment. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This is a watershed moment </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NYT’s Andrew Ross Sorkin <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/14/business/dealbook/larry-fink-blackrock-climate-change.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> Fink’s letter “could reshape how corporate America does business.” While many companies and investors like to tout their do-goodery, no money manager in BlackRock’s league has made a statement like this. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/jpmorgan-reports-stellar-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
JPMorgan Had Its Best Year Ever
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="man throwing glitter " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=442 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/s2qXK8wAvkHTO/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="man throwing glitter " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/s2qXK8wAvkHTO/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S.’ largest bank reported a 21% jump in profit in Q4 to close out 2019 with a record $36.4 billion in earnings. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What worked: <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bond trading revenue </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-jpmorgan-results/jpmorgan-posts-record-annual-profit-as-bond-trading-rebounds-idUSKBN1ZD1FD?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose 86%</a></span><span> annually (though if you remember the financial markets in Q4 2018, they were a disaster).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Debt underwriting fees increased 11% annually thanks to an especially busy bond issuance season. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Chase credit card customers </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-chase-reports-profit-rose-21-11579003228?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent 10%</a></span><span> more than a year earlier.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What didn’t work:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span> </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So where do you go from here? CFO Jennifer Piepszak <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-14/jpmorgan-s-trading-surge-helps-fuel-most-profitable-year-ever?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">laid out</a> a few potential growth areas for JPMorgan, such as its credit card business, investment banking in “underpenetrated” locations, and branch expansion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>CEO Jamie Dimon, 63, said <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/14/for-jamie-dimon-retirement-from-jp-morgan-is-always-five-years-away.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retirement</a> is at least five years away. That’s the same thing he said two years ago, so don’t read too much into it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>Let’s talk about other big bank earnings. Citigroup <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/14/citigroup-c-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cruised</a> past expectations while Wells Fargo was once again <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-wells-fargo-results/wells-fargos-new-chief-pledges-more-cost-cuts-as-profit-slumps-idUSKBN1ZD1MK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hamstrung</a> by legal costs. Bank of America and Goldman Sachs are up today.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/nsa-tries-win-back-trust-tipping-off-microsoft-security-flaw?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's a Party in the NSA
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="National Security Agency " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjE1L25hdGlvbmFsX3NlY3VyaXR5X2FnZW5jeS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>National Security Agency</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In its first “Patch Tuesday” of the year, Microsoft <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/14/21065563/microsoft-windows-security-flaw-nsa-patch-attribution-cryptography-update?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disclosed</a> a serious flaw in some versions of its Windows operating system. Microsoft doesn’t think hackers have exploited the flaw, and it <a href="https://krebsonsecurity.com/2020/01/cryptic-rumblings-ahead-of-first-2020-patch-tuesday/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">provided</a> patches to the military and other high-value targets ahead of yesterday's release.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now for the <em>actual</em> news:</strong> The National Security Agency (NSA) tipped off Microsoft.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NSA has helped companies identify vulnerabilities before, but this is <a href="https://twitter.com/briankrebs/status/1217128563620700160?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the first time</a> it’s taken credit. Going public is the first step in <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/14/tech/nsa-microsoft-patch/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">building trust</a> with cybersecurity researchers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Microsoft security researchers have special reason to distrust the NSA. Years ago, the agency knew about a Windows vulnerability, but instead of saying anything, it built a hacking tool (called EternalBlue) for its own purposes instead. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2017, hackers exploited that vulnerability, crippling networks around the world with WannaCry ransomware. The NSA faced criticism after people found out it could have been prevented. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Later that year, the government <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-releases-patch-to-severe-windows-flaw-detected-by-nsa-11579030780?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a blueprint for intelligence agencies to follow when they identify flaws in consumer software.</p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+NSA+has+helped+companies+identify+vulnerabilities+before%2C+but+this+is+the+first+time+it%E2%80%99s+taken+credit&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/nsa-tries-win-back-trust-tipping-off-microsoft-security-flaw&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>

ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/eu-making-climate-nuclear-moves-e?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tuesdays Are the New Mondays at the EU
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="EU HQ" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5MDM1NDU5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The EU is <a href="https://apnews.com/5d4db8ffda58f03f090a04c35f0a2dc8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allocating</a> a quarter of its budget (~$1.1 trillion) this decade to green up its economy and meet a 2050 carbon neutrality goal set by European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/banknote-with-dollar-sign_1f4b5.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> The EU will put up half, national governments ($111+ billion) and the private sector ($333+ billion) the rest.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/oil-drum_1f6e2.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> An <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/davekeating/2020/01/14/eu-unveils-fund-to-woo-poland-on-climate/#22495dbb42e2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$8.3 billion seed</a> expected to generate around $111 billion will help fossil fuel-dependent countries like Poland transition to a greener economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/memo_1f4dd.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Countries will submit their economic restructuring plans to the European Commission for approval and funding.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s not in there:</strong> Tying funding to commitments that <a href="https://www.euronews.com/2020/01/14/eu-commission-to-unveil-green-deal-to-make-europe-the-first-climate-neutral-continent?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phase out</a> coal or support for commercial nuclear power. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Speaking of nuclear...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.K., France, and Germany are not happy with Iran’s<a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/european-countries-to-hold-iran-accountable-for-violating-nuclear-deal/2020/01/14/4788c1d2-36bf-11ea-a1ff-c48c1d59a4a1_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"> repeated violations</a> of the 2015 nuclear deal after the U.S. pulled out. Yesterday, they asked as nicely as possible for Iran to step back into the agreement’s boundaries, <a href="https://apnews.com/76ef3722e781efed91a832a44d25917d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">triggering</a> a 30-day window for the dispute to get resolved. If it doesn’t…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The dispute heads to the UN, which could <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-51104579?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reimpose</a> sanctions that were lifted in 2015. And that would likely be the end of the deal.</p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, we asked you to share the most creative ways you’ve gone after a job. Here are some reader strategies that actually worked:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"My boyfriend sent Google a Christmas card...also wrote 'world's former youngest person' on the last line of his resume. He starts next week."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>DMing the manager on Instagram</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sending a bouquet of balloons on Valentine’s Day with a card that read, “I don’t want to be your Valentine but I do want to be your Marketing Director”</span></li>
</ul>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSUSTAINABILITY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/investors-tough-passive-aggressive?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nMore Like GreenRock\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An illustration of a gas pump covered in leaves\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5MDM2NzY4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, BlackRock CEO Larry Fink \u003ca href=\"https://www.blackrock.com/us/individual/larry-fink-ceo-letter?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e in his annual letter to CEOs that he plans to make confronting climate change a key component of his firm’s strategy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBlackRock is the world’s biggest asset manager and banks rely on its software to assess risk. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFink said the economic consequences of climate change pushed him to make the decision. “The evidence on climate risk is compelling investors to reassess core assumptions about modern finance,” he wrote. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat it means \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFink said BlackRock will \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/blackrock-shakes-up-sustainable-investing-business-following-criticism-11579000873?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evote against\u003c/a\u003e boards and management that fail to a) account for climate risks or b) make progress on sustainability plans. Other \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-14/blackrock-s-uncomfortable-truth-going-green-won-t-be-easy?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBlackRock strategies\u003c/a\u003e are to...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePressure index providers to add more sustainable benchmarks \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDouble its sustainable exchange-traded funds (ETFs) to 150 \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSell $500 million worth of investments in thermal coal producers by the middle of 2020\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere’s the catch: \u003c/strong\u003eNeither Fink nor BlackRock can really flip that switch. Two-thirds of BlackRock’s almost $7 trillion under management is held in passive funds that follow market indexes wherever they may lead. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMarket compilers like MSCI and the London Stock Exchange’s FTSE Russell unit call the shots on those funds, not BlackRock. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSo BlackRock will have to lean hard on strategy #1 if it’s going to deliver on this goal. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eLast year, protesters \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-climate-change-britain-blackrock/climate-activists-protest-at-blackrock-over-investments-in-the-amazon-idUSKBN1XP13X?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried to persuade\u003c/a\u003e BlackRock to divest from its fossil fuel holdings. Now, BlackRock could lead other money managers in a pivot to sustainability. Earlier this month, it joined \u003ca href=\"https://climateaction100.wordpress.com/about-us/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eClimate Action 100+\u003c/a\u003e, a group of investors committing to the environment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis is a watershed moment \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe NYT’s Andrew Ross Sorkin \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/14/business/dealbook/larry-fink-blackrock-climate-change.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e Fink’s letter “could reshape how corporate America does business.” While many companies and investors like to tout their do-goodery, no money manager in BlackRock’s league has made a statement like this. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S.’ largest bank reported a 21% jump in profit in Q4 to close out 2019 with a record $36.4 billion in earnings. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat worked: \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBond trading revenue \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-jpmorgan-results/jpmorgan-posts-record-annual-profit-as-bond-trading-rebounds-idUSKBN1ZD1FD?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose 86%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e annually (though if you remember the financial markets in Q4 2018, they were a disaster).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDebt underwriting fees increased 11% annually thanks to an especially busy bond issuance season. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eChase credit card customers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-chase-reports-profit-rose-21-11579003228?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espent 10%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e more than a year earlier.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat didn’t work:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo where do you go from here? CFO Jennifer Piepszak \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-14/jpmorgan-s-trading-surge-helps-fuel-most-profitable-year-ever?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaid out\u003c/a\u003e a few potential growth areas for JPMorgan, such as its credit card business, investment banking in “underpenetrated” locations, and branch expansion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eCEO Jamie Dimon, 63, said \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/14/for-jamie-dimon-retirement-from-jp-morgan-is-always-five-years-away.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretirement\u003c/a\u003e is at least five years away. That’s the same thing he said two years ago, so don’t read too much into it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eLet’s talk about other big bank earnings. Agency\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn its first “Patch Tuesday” of the year, Microsoft \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/14/21065563/microsoft-windows-security-flaw-nsa-patch-attribution-cryptography-update?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisclosed\u003c/a\u003e a serious flaw in some versions of its Windows operating system. Microsoft doesn’t think hackers have exploited the flaw, and it \u003ca href=\"https://krebsonsecurity.com/2020/01/cryptic-rumblings-ahead-of-first-2020-patch-tuesday/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprovided\u003c/a\u003e patches to the military and other high-value targets ahead of yesterday's release.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNow for the \u003cem\u003eactual\u003c/em\u003e news:\u003c/strong\u003e The National Security Agency (NSA) tipped off Microsoft.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe NSA has helped companies identify vulnerabilities before, but this is \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/briankrebs/status/1217128563620700160?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe first time\u003c/a\u003e it’s taken credit. Going public is the first step in \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/14/tech/nsa-microsoft-patch/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuilding trust\u003c/a\u003e with cybersecurity researchers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eMicrosoft security researchers have special reason to distrust the NSA. Years ago, the agency knew about a Windows vulnerability, but instead of saying anything, it built a hacking tool (called EternalBlue) for its own purposes instead. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2017, hackers exploited that vulnerability, crippling networks around the world with WannaCry ransomware. The NSA faced criticism after people found out it could have been prevented. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLater that year, the government \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-releases-patch-to-severe-windows-flaw-detected-by-nsa-11579030780?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a blueprint for intelligence agencies to follow when they identify flaws in consumer software.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: href=\"https://apnews.com/5d4db8ffda58f03f090a04c35f0a2dc8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eallocating\u003c/a\u003e a quarter of its budget (~$1.1 trillion) this decade to green up its economy and meet a 2050 carbon neutrality goal set by European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e The EU will put up half, national governments ($111+ billion) and the private sector ($333+ billion) the rest.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/oil-drum_1f6e2.png\" href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/davekeating/2020/01/14/eu-unveils-fund-to-woo-poland-on-climate/#22495dbb42e2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$8.3 billion seed\u003c/a\u003e expected to generate around $111 billion will help fossil fuel-dependent countries like Poland transition to a greener economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/memo_1f4dd.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"18\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e Countries will submit their economic restructuring plans to the European Commission for approval and funding.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s not in there:\u003c/strong\u003e Tying funding to commitments that \u003ca href=\"https://www.euronews.com/2020/01/14/eu-commission-to-unveil-green-deal-to-make-europe-the-first-climate-neutral-continent?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ephase out\u003c/a\u003e coal or support for commercial nuclear power. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSpeaking of nuclear...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.K., France, and Germany are not happy with Iran’s\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/european-countries-to-hold-iran-accountable-for-violating-nuclear-deal/2020/01/14/4788c1d2-36bf-11ea-a1ff-c48c1d59a4a1_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e repeated violations\u003c/a\u003e of the 2015 nuclear deal after the U.S. pulled out. Yesterday, they asked as nicely as possible for Iran to step back into the agreement’s boundaries, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/76ef3722e781efed91a832a44d25917d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etriggering\u003c/a\u003e a 30-day window for the dispute to get resolved. If it doesn’t…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe dispute heads to the UN, which could \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-51104579?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereimpose\u003c/a\u003e sanctions that were lifted in 2015.
